[{'created': '2021-09-04 13:10:57.000000000', 'message': 'Allow purging policy files

This change introduces the new purge_config parameter to the policy
class so that any policy rules not managed by puppet manifests can be
cleared.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Allow purging policy files

This change introduces the new purge_config parameter to the policy
class so that any policy rules not managed by puppet manifests can be
cleared.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/802305
Change-Id: Ic228fce771c936d8f9837c1e5f4d4403c7b24a9e

commit_message:
Add missing [oslo_reports] options

The oslo.reports library provides some options under the [oslo_reports]
section. This change ensures these parameters are rendered by
the oslo-config-generator command.

Change-Id: Ibcd7ec68138f4061f358aff456fc8ac029bcff41

subject: Remove single quotes in exception message
messages:
[{'account_id': 23950, 'date': '2021-09-08 06:40:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-09-08 17:17:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I'm not sure I see the point of this patch. The bug shows the HTML escapes used, which is exactly what you'd expect in an HTML error message that includes escape-able characters.

What does this actually fix? I'm not sure I think the new version of these messages is really better or worth the change, IMHO."}, {'account_id': 23950, 'date': '2021-09-11 02:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23950, 'date': '2021-09-11 02:18:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)

In fact, this patch has no functional problems, just an improvement of the user experience.'}, {'account_id': 8122, 'date': '2021-09-20 13:48:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I must say I like the current version better. I really don't understand how the new version is an improvement."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-09-20 13:50:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

> I must say I like the current version better. I really don't understand how the new version is an improvement.

As noted in my previous review, I agree. Putting my -1 back on here to signal that."}, {'account_id': 23950, 'date': '2021-09-21 01:38:04.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

OK, abandon this patch.'}]

commit_message:
Remove single quotes in exception message

There are escape characters in the returned exception message. This patch
removes these single quotes.

Closes-Bug: #1942977
Change-Id: I7fea410a1bdee883e965b0dca4a5ffe8b36ff067

commit_message:
Add release note about xena policy changes

NOTE: Because we're specifically talking about xena changes,
the URLs in the release note are to the *xena* version of the
cinder documentation, which has not yet been published.

Change-Id: I1d76333d3d6048cd1562b7f0634177dc2d507e94

commit_message:
[Stable-Only]Reversing the legacy directory conditional

The legacy directory can exist, but the validations don't have to be there.
In such a case, the legacy directory would still be used by VF,
instead of the new directory containing validation playbooks.

This patch reverses the condition, so that the client first
attempts to use the new validations playbook directory,
and only if it doesn't exist falls back to the legacy one.

Resolves: rhbz#2001968

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I644cdafeaee07c180db61cbdfb109e0a0a8dafed

subject: Fix neutron upgrade using host limit without controllers
messages:
[{'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2021-09-10 20:23:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2021-09-13 07:49:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Alternative fix to https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/804384'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-09-13 09:11:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Looking through the rolling upgrade case, if we upgrade without controllers in the limit, the following should happen:

* DB expand
* restart neutron compute containers
* DB contract

The DB operations should be no-ops, assuming that you have already upgraded the controllers. If you haven't already upgraded the controllers, there is potential to perform offline migrations with neutron-server containers running.

tl;dr I think this approach is fine, if you know what you are doing, and that is a prerequisite for using --limit."}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-09-15 20:09:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Reno missing'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-09-15 20:18:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hmm, maybe you could explain to me guys, how is it possible that change order of conditionals in when: is fixing issue ? It is normal logical AND, and vars which are checked are defined in task's vars. What i'm missing :( ?"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-09-16 08:23:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Hmm, maybe you could explain to me guys, how is it possible that change order of conditionals in when: is fixing issue ? It is normal logical AND, and vars which are checked are defined in task's vars. What i'm missing :( ?

Jinja is lazy, so if the first condition is false then the second won't be evaluated, even if it's undefined."}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-09-16 08:31:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > Patch Set 1:
> > 
> > Hmm, maybe you could explain to me guys, how is it possible that change order of conditionals in when: is fixing issue ? It is normal logical AND, and vars which are checked are defined in task's vars. What i'm missing :( ?
> 
> Jinja is lazy, so if the first condition is false then the second won't be evaluated, even if it's undefined.

Hmm, ok, then it makes sense. What about other run_once and delegate to ? Shouldn't be also reworked as Radoslaw mentioned in my original patch ?"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-09-16 08:38:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > 
> > Jinja is lazy, so if the first condition is false then the second won't be evaluated, even if it's undefined.
> 
> Hmm, ok, then it makes sense. What about other run_once and delegate to ? Shouldn't be also reworked as Radoslaw mentioned in my original patch ?

We use that pattern everywhere. It could be reworked, but I think that's a separate job."}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-09-16 08:41:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Fix neutron upgrade using host limit without controllers

When running kolla-ansible upgrade with a host limit that does not
include controllers, the neutron upgrade fails.

Change-Id: I7125a6ef1f180db6997026ff27e84feb04ee239d
Closes-Bug: #1939691

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-26 17:51:33.000000000', 'message': "Retry update_user when sqlalchemy raises StaleDataErrors

Keystone's update_user() method in the SQL driver processes a lot of
information about how to update users. This includes evaluating password
logic and authentication attempts for PSI-DSS. This logic is evaluated
after keystone pulls the user record from SQL and before it exits the
context manager, which performs the write.

When multiple clients are all updating the same user reference, it's
more likely they will see an HTTP 500 because of race conditions exiting
the context manager. The HTTP 500 is due to stale data when updating
password expiration for old passwords, which happens when setting a new
password for a user.

This commit attempts to handle that case more gracefully than throwing a
500 by detecting StaleDataErrors from sqlalchemy and retrying.  The
identity sql backend will retry the request for clients that have
stale data change from underneath them.

Change-Id: I75590c20e90170ed862f46f0de7d61c7810b5c90
Closes-Bug: 1885753
(cherry picked from commit 6b581bfe43811379e9ceea2770242f05f0c9fa66)
(cherry picked from commit 22119176d612d4441d9cf25e76adde52ec4f88e2)
(cherry picked from commit 20a10ebc50fda0ac3cfab378293f9f2c27168c96)
(cherry picked from commit 72e1cab0a47f493d47dbe482a03da269b4238967)
(cherry picked from commit 0345cf175971a89f73e61f1f84e3ef8f89770f18)
"}, {'created': '2021-03-29 19:27:36.000000000', 'message': "Retry update_user when sqlalchemy raises StaleDataErrors

Keystone's update_user() method in the SQL driver processes a lot of
information about how to update users. This includes evaluating password
logic and authentication attempts for PSI-DSS. This logic is evaluated
after keystone pulls the user record from SQL and before it exits the
context manager, which performs the write.

When multiple clients are all updating the same user reference, it's
more likely they will see an HTTP 500 because of race conditions exiting
the context manager. The HTTP 500 is due to stale data when updating
password expiration for old passwords, which happens when setting a new
password for a user.

This commit attempts to handle that case more gracefully than throwing a
500 by detecting StaleDataErrors from sqlalchemy and retrying.  The
identity sql backend will retry the request for clients that have
stale data change from underneath them.

Conflicts:
      keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_sql.py due to import order
      differences between train and ussuri.

"}, {'created': '2021-03-30 19:40:48.000000000', 'message': "Retry update_user when sqlalchemy raises StaleDataErrors

Keystone's update_user() method in the SQL driver processes a lot of
information about how to update users. This includes evaluating password
logic and authentication attempts for PSI-DSS. This logic is evaluated
after keystone pulls the user record from SQL and before it exits the
context manager, which performs the write.

When multiple clients are all updating the same user reference, it's
more likely they will see an HTTP 500 because of race conditions exiting
the context manager. The HTTP 500 is due to stale data when updating
password expiration for old passwords, which happens when setting a new
password for a user.

This commit attempts to handle that case more gracefully than throwing a
500 by detecting StaleDataErrors from sqlalchemy and retrying.  The
identity sql backend will retry the request for clients that have
stale data change from underneath them.

Conflicts:
      keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_sql.py due to import order
      differences between train and ussuri. Also adjust the expected log
      message since the method path is different compared to older
      releases, which have the driver name in them (e.g., Identity).

commit_message:
Retry update_user when sqlalchemy raises StaleDataErrors

Keystone's update_user() method in the SQL driver processes a lot of
information about how to update users. This includes evaluating password
logic and authentication attempts for PSI-DSS. This logic is evaluated
after keystone pulls the user record from SQL and before it exits the
context manager, which performs the write.

When multiple clients are all updating the same user reference, it's
more likely they will see an HTTP 500 because of race conditions exiting
the context manager. The HTTP 500 is due to stale data when updating
password expiration for old passwords, which happens when setting a new
password for a user.

This commit attempts to handle that case more gracefully than throwing a
500 by detecting StaleDataErrors from sqlalchemy and retrying.  The
identity sql backend will retry the request for clients that have
stale data change from underneath them.

Conflicts:
      keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_sql.py due to import order
      differences between train and ussuri. Also adjust the expected log
      message since the method path is different compared to older
      releases, which have the driver name in them (e.g., Identity).

Change-Id: I75590c20e90170ed862f46f0de7d61c7810b5c90
Closes-Bug: 1885753
(cherry picked from commit ceae3566e83b26fd6a1679154eae9b0cef29da64)
(cherry picked from commit f47e635b8041542faa05e64606e66d2fbbc5f284)
(cherry picked from commit 5b7d4c80d484262018f937083050844648f07a11)

commit_message:
Pin virtualenv to 20.7.2

Current latest 20.8.0 have updated embedded pip 21.2.4 and setuptools
58.4.8 incompatible with some of constrainted packages.

commit_message:
Automatically page interactive root help output

The previous commit already ensures that the interactive help for
individual commands is sent to a pager. This does the same for the
'help' command with no arguments.

Change-Id: If5e38421d21e09f88a572dbb508b1997381bdb87

commit_message:
Raise minimum oslo.log to 4.5.0

The cinder/policies/base.py file makes reference to
versionutils.deprecated.XENA, so we need to make sure we're using
a release of oslo.log where that's available, which will be
any release containing change I6bf6997899f6c95e.

Change-Id: I292dc5fd764dae1a59f9d8f3d14c523aff92ca88
(cherry picked from commit dfcf4817c0a7506fea9e60667e44f79ad2e015c0)

solution.

I4f22fe7b453940.

(2 comments)

Okay, I love this.

One thing to do is that we need to update names in other projects running our jobs. Looks like os-vif [1] will be okay but not ovn-octavia-provider [2].

Can you also create a dummy patch in kuryr-tempest-plugin with Depends-On this one? My gut feeling is that it should be fine but I'm not 100% sure looking at this [3].

> 
> (2 comments)
> 
> Okay, I love this.
> 
> One thing to do is that we need to update names in other projects running our jobs. Looks like os-vif [1] will be okay but not ovn-octavia-provider [2].
> 
> Can you also create a dummy patch in kuryr-tempest-plugin with Depends-On this one? My gut feeling is that it should be fine but I'm not 100% sure looking at this [3].
> 
> [1] https://opendev.org/openstack/os-vif/src/branch/master/.zuul.yaml#L169-L170
> [2] https://opendev.org/openstack/ovn-octavia-provider/src/branch/master/zuul.d/project.yaml#L18-L19
> [3] https://opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-tempest-plugin/src/branch/master/.zuul.yaml#L28-L55

For now, there are job aliases I left for that purpose, and my thinking was to merge this patch first, than make change in related projects, and finally remove aliases our definition on merge on the related projects. That said, we do have aliases for ovn-octavia-provider:

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/+/802999/74/.zuul.d/tempest-jobs.yaml#22

and for kuryr-tempest-plugin and os-vif:

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/+/802999/74/.zuul.d/tempest-jobs.yaml#22

Note, that 'kuryr-kubernetes-tempest' is ambiguous name for defining base job, since we do have a combination of OVS/OVN/OVN-provider/Amphora, where you could have ovn-amphora, ovn-ovn-provider, and ovs-amphora, which makes three different set of "base" for our tempest tests.'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2021-09-15 08:45:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 74:

'}, {'created': '2021-09-09 10:27:51.000000000', 'message': 'Switch gates to OVN by default.

Also, rearrange tests files.

Job hierarchy looks as follows

- kuryr-kubernetes-base (base tempest job)
  - kuryr-kubernetes-base-ovn (derived from base for neutron OVN)
    - kuryr-kubernetes-octavia-base (ovn-octavia-provider)
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest (alias for the parent,
        used in projects kuryr-tempest-plugin and os-vif)
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-ovn-provider-ovn (alias for the parent,
        used in project ovn-octavia-provider)
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-systemd
        - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-centos-7 (this one is probably
          broken)
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-defaults (default settings for
        kuryr-kubernetes, so OVN + amphora + default set of handlers,
        default subnet and sg drivers)
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-ipv6
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-dual-stack
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-lower-constraints
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-l2
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-pools-namespace
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-crio (currently broken)
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-ovn-amphora
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-multinode
        - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-multinode-ha
  - kuryr-kubernetes-base-ovs (derived from base for neutron OVS)
    - kuryr-kubernetes-octavia-base-ovs (amphora)
    - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-ovs-ipv6
    - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-ovs-amphora
    - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-multinode-ovs
- kuryr-kubernetes-e2e-np (base devstack job)

For convenience, tempest jobs are in two files: one for multinode jobs,
and one for one node jobs. Network policy job is in its own file, since
it have different parent (devstack).

Change-Id: I198f138feb9bd7b6cc659ac8cd788cddd5be9439

commit_message:
Switch gates to OVN by default.

Also, rearrange tests files.

Job hierarchy looks as follows:

- kuryr-kubernetes-base (base tempest job)
  - kuryr-kubernetes-base-ovn (derived from base for neutron OVN)
    - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-amphora
    - kuryr-kubernetes-octavia-base (ovn-octavia-provider)
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest (alias for the parent,
        used in projects kuryr-tempest-plugin and os-vif)
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-ovn-provider-ovn (alias for the parent,
        used in project ovn-octavia-provider)
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-systemd
        - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-centos-7 (this one is probably
          broken)
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-defaults (default settings for
        kuryr-kubernetes, so OVN + amphora + default set of handlers,
        default subnet and sg drivers)
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-ipv6
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-dual-stack
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-lower-constraints
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-l2
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-pools-namespace
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-crio (currently broken)
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-multinode
        - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-multinode-ha
  - kuryr-kubernetes-base-ovs (derived from base for neutron OVS)
    - kuryr-kubernetes-octavia-base-ovs (amphora)
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-ipv6-ovs
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-amphora-ovs
      - kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-multinode-ovs
- kuryr-kubernetes-e2e-np (base devstack job)

For convenience, tempest jobs are in two files: one for multinode jobs,
and one for one node jobs. Network policy job is in its own file, since
it have different parent (devstack).

Change-Id: I198f138feb9bd7b6cc659ac8cd788cddd5be9439

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-07 17:31:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix zone transfer policies

Several of the zone transfer request policies/deprecations were
incorrect. One of them was using the wrong alias, which caused the
deprecation logic to render the policy as an alias because it thought
the policy name was changing. The get_zone_transfer_request_detailed
policy needed to reference the correct deprecation and the
get_zone_transfer_request policy was missing a rule update to implement
system scope.

Change-Id: I07af5163d18f70ae4e53acb0686b47efc9918310
'}]
commit_message:
Fix zone transfer policies

Several of the zone transfer request policies/deprecations were
incorrect. One of them was using the wrong alias, which caused the
deprecation logic to render the policy as an alias because it thought
the policy name was changing. The get_zone_transfer_request_detailed
policy needed to reference the correct deprecation and the
get_zone_transfer_request policy was missing a rule update to implement
system scope.

Change-Id: I07af5163d18f70ae4e53acb0686b47efc9918310

[{'created': '2021-08-27 17:14:35.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Experiment with alternative policy testing strategy

This commit attempts to test the list backups policy using a variety of
context objects. All should succeed since the list API is relatively
permissive, but we need to make sure certain things are or are not
returned. For example, a user should be able to list backups in their
project, but not someone else's project.

This commit introduces a way to test this API that is relatively
straight forward.

Change-Id: I619a06b8d8a78f906abf3c44d08a29fb35ba063f
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Experiment with alternative policy testing strategy

This commit attempts to test the list backups policy using a variety of
context objects. All should succeed since the list API is relatively
permissive, but we need to make sure certain things are or are not
returned. For example, a user should be able to list backups in their
project, but not someone else's project.

This commit introduces a way to test this API that is relatively
straight forward.

Change-Id: I619a06b8d8a78f906abf3c44d08a29fb35ba063f

commit_message:
Fix MAX_TIMEOUT value for listener

In the database, timeout_client_data, timeout_member_connect,
timeout_member_data, timeout_tcp_inspect have an integer type with
a maximum size of 2147483647. Now MAX_TIMEOUT in API does not exceed
this value and is equal to 24 days (2073600000 seconds).

Story: 2009193
Task: 43248
Change-Id: I990b6af1ff880b25e54f6c41ae0c966007f3f098
(cherry picked from commit 3a8f056306bba4502639bfc89752d8a48d694e7f)

This commit updates the multi-node definition to deploy secure RBAC
using the environment/enable-secure-rbac.yaml template.

This is designed to help us flush out places in tripleo that rely on
using project-scoped admin tokens to interact with system-level APIs. We
will need to update those places to work with system scope.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/781571
Change-Id: Ic764765a356b14ca7b479501a72e38a6f3007041
'}]
commit_message:
DNM: Include secure RBAC template for multi-node jobs

This commit updates the multi-node definition to deploy secure RBAC
using the environment/enable-secure-rbac.yaml template.

This is designed to help us flush out places in tripleo that rely on
using project-scoped admin tokens to interact with system-level APIs. We
will need to update those places to work with system scope.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/781571
Change-Id: Ic764765a356b14ca7b479501a72e38a6f3007041

commit_message:
Add override timeout for openstack exporter

Add scrape_timeout option in
prometheus_openstack_exporter job in order
to avoid timeout for large Openstack environment.

Change-Id: If96034e602bee3b3eea34a2656047355e1d17eec
Closes-Bug: #1903547
(cherry picked from commit 99680b56ef330a3cb44e58a12fcf67fdba328543)

commit_message:
Add disable_firewall variable

Adds a new variable, 'disable_firewall', which defaults to true. If set
to false, then the host firewall will not be disabled during
kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers.

Change-Id: Ie5131013012f89c8c3b91ca359ad17d9cb77efc8

commit_message:
Update policies related to user visible extra specs

The policies for volume types was updated in [1][2] in order to
implement project personas related to secure RBAC. However, that
work did not take into account the new user visible extra specs
feature [3]. This patch updates the policies related to [3] so
that they now implement the proper project personas.

[1] Id5ea2c81bedf51f3e0b4c5cb4ef569f255143a9e
[2] I52de98d80e80e2c315c6e329a9ead6f83713eca2
[3] I5434ea4199cce8158b75771fb6127be001baf328

Closes-Bug: #1943733

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-28 19:11:48.000000000', 'message': 'Add different migration actions based on guest

There are currently workloads that do not support live-migration during
the upgrades process. Example workloads include guests with SR-IOV
ports, pci-passthrough, or cpu pinning. Nova would also like to test the
results of upgrades when a workload is not migrated off a host and is
left in place.

This commit checks a workloads metadata and takes the appropriate action
based on the data. I.e. it will live, cold, or not migrate based on the
metadata of the instance. If no meta-data is present on the instance
describing the workload action, it will default to live-migration.

Change-Id: I781a894089320067d0ad3e174aed18fabe7c6ce2

commit_message:
Add different migration actions based on guest

There are currently workloads that do not support live-migration during
the upgrades process. Example workloads include guests with SR-IOV
ports, pci-passthrough, ovs+dpdk vhost ports, or cpu pinning. Nova would
also like to test the results of upgrades when a workload is not
migrated off a host and is left in place.

This commit checks a workloads metadata and takes the appropriate action
based on the data. I.e. it will live, cold, or not migrate based on the
metadata of the instance. If no meta-data is present on the instance
describing the workload action, it will default to live migration unless
compute_cold_evacuate is set, in which case it will default to cold
migration.

Change-Id: I781a894089320067d0ad3e174aed18fabe7c6ce2

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-03 15:26:07.000000000', 'message': "Add kolla-ansible gather-facts command

In some situations it may be helpful to populate the fact cache on
demand. The 'kolla-ansible gather-facts' command may be used to do this.

One specific case where this may be helpful is when running kolla-ansible
with a --limit argument, since in that case hosts that match the limit
will gather facts for hosts that fall outside the limit. In the extreme
case of a limit that matches only one host, it will serially gather
facts for all other hosts. To avoid this issue, run 'kolla-ansible
gather-facts' without a limit to populate the fact cache in parallel
before running the required command with a limit.

Change-Id: I79db9bca23aa1bd45bafa7e7500a90de5a684593
"}, {'created': '2021-07-26 15:37:22.000000000', 'message': "Add kolla-ansible gather-facts command

gather-facts' without a limit to populate the fact cache in parallel
before running the required command with a limit.

Change-Id: I79db9bca23aa1bd45bafa7e7500a90de5a684593
"}, {'created': '2021-08-25 15:45:47.000000000', 'message': "Add kolla-ansible gather-facts command

will gather facts for hosts that fall outside the limit. In the extreme
case of a limit that matches only one host, it will serially gather
facts for all other hosts. To avoid this issue, run 'kolla-ansible
gather-facts' without a limit to populate the fact cache in parallel
before running the required command with a limit.

Change-Id: I79db9bca23aa1bd45bafa7e7500a90de5a684593
"}]
commit_message:
Add kolla-ansible gather-facts command

In some situations it may be helpful to populate the fact cache on
demand. The 'kolla-ansible gather-facts' command may be used to do this.

One specific case where this may be helpful is when running kolla-ansible
with a --limit argument, since in that case hosts that match the limit
will gather facts for hosts that fall outside the limit. In the extreme
case of a limit that matches only one host, it will serially gather
facts for all other hosts. To avoid this issue, run 'kolla-ansible
gather-facts' without a limit to populate the fact cache in parallel
before running the required command with a limit.

Change-Id: I79db9bca23aa1bd45bafa7e7500a90de5a684593

The cinder/policies/base.py file makes reference to

Change-Id: I292dc5fd764dae1a59f9d8f3d14c523aff92ca88

commit_message:
Raise minimum oslo.log to 4.5.0

The cinder/policies/base.py file makes reference to
versionutils.deprecated.XENA, so we need to make sure we're using
a release of oslo.log where that's available, which will be
any release containing change I6bf6997899f6c95e.

Change-Id: I292dc5fd764dae1a59f9d8f3d14c523aff92ca88

[{'created': '2021-09-10 14:35:11.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I458d24745d4bf3c765c9f456803e98a1105c3dc6
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I458d24745d4bf3c765c9f456803e98a1105c3dc6

commit_message:
CI: Remove IPA images from saved /etc/kolla

This saves 156MB of storage in each CentOS job on the master branch.

Backport note: ironic-ipxe is Xena only. Storage space saved on Wallaby
and older will be about half (varies depending on Linux distribution and
OpenStack release).

Change-Id: Icb3569bc764435127a00ee15583c6f3e4e598eca

messages:
[{'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-08-23 05:17:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-08-23 09:40:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hey. Do you guys want to let me know what you think of handling the minor update run this way? I tested it, and it works. But you guys might have other ideas.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-08-23 13:01:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

approach lgtm, just need to not assume $HOME and use the default working dir instead, and we may want to provide a way to override that with a new cli arg, but that could be a follow up'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-08-23 13:15:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-08-23 13:16:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-08-23 16:42:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-08-26 06:34:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-08-27 03:26:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Let's update the doc strings to reflect what 'update prepare' is  doing in ephermeal-heat world. 

Also, the following changes would be needed.

1. Drop 'update converge'. These is no stack to be in old state to be updated back and the parameters in https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/environments/lifecycle/update-converge.yaml are not update specific and don't change anything in the playbooks.

2. Change overcloud deploy to drop --setup-only which is not relevant anymore."}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-08-27 04:24:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-08-27 04:33:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-08-27 04:40:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-08-27 05:01:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-08-27 05:16:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-08-27 10:14:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-08-29 23:18:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-08-30 03:17:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-08-30 11:14:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-08-30 11:38:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-08-31 00:05:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2021-09-02 13:07:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

Hi, I really need to look more at this, but I know of tasks that are happening during converge and don't happen during update (like tripleo-hosts-entries role).  I'm basing this on older version than master, but we need to check that all deployments tasks happen during update.

If it's already the case, sorry for the noise :)"}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-09-02 13:27:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

> Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1
> 
> Hi, I really need to look more at this, but I know of tasks that are happening during converge and don't happen during update (like tripleo-hosts-entries role).  I'm basing this on older version than master, but we need to check that all deployments tasks happen during update.
> 
> If it's already the case, sorry for the noise :)

Yeah, that tripleo_hosts_entries role will run with the deploy_steps_playbook. I guess the point of removing converge is that we don't have a persistent Heat stack anymore. The reason we were doing it originally was to update the Heat stack after the update run and change a few variables back. All of which is unnecessary now with Ephemeral Heat. 

Running a full deployment like this would definitely be unnecessary now:
https://github.com/openstack/python-tripleoclient/blob/master/tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_update.py#L259

But maybe we could just re-run the `deploy_steps_playbook.yaml` without the stack update part if that would satisfy the requirements you're thinking of?"}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-09-06 11:44:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-09-06 11:50:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-09-06 12:52:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-09-06 13:02:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-09-06 14:48:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-09-07 18:29:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-09-07 20:32:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-09-07 22:50:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-09-08 02:13:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-09-08 15:27:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-09-10 03:20:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-09-13 10:33:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-09-13 10:54:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-09-16 22:26:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-09-20 07:38:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-09-20 13:42:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Code-Review+2

this is a net improvement imo. I don't see any reason to not merge this. Discussion about keeping "update converge" is a separate patch.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-09-20 13:56:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

>  I don't see any reason to not merge this. Discussion about keeping "update converge" is a separate patch

Well, I've not seen any concrete justification on why we need to run deploy-steps after an minor update, when the stack or playbooks does not change.

Having said that, we surely can merge as is and change if required later.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-09-20 15:16:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Fix update run for Ephemeral Heat

When using ephemeral Heat, the update run can no
longer rely on the Heat stack being present. Since
we create the stack and update the playbooks during
update prepare. We can simply execute the
update_steps_playbook.yaml now.

With this change, we also change the converge to just
execute the deploy_steps_playbook.yaml without doing
the entire stack update. The stack update is no longer
necessary with Ephemeral Heat.

Related: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/+/806565
Change-Id: I57d788639b651945ad765f810b504529e41f0fbd

commit_message:
Remove httplog and forwardfor in defaults section for haproxy.cfg

mode http is removed by Id2079c5a491ef8691e7ad8846a5fec99e49ec4ba, and
httplog should be removed too. Otherwise, haproxy will throw warning
like,

    'option httplog' not usable with proxy 'rabbitmq_management' (needs
    'mode http'). Falling back to 'option tcplog'.

Change-Id: Ia9c91a32623f3593b57195b75e65db9284416521

subject: Fix duplicate SG creation for listener peer port
messages: [{'account_id': 10366, 'date': '2021-09-15 03:07:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 29244, 'date': '2021-09-15 07:03:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2021-09-20 14:14:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-15 03:07:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fix duplicate SG creation for listener peer port

In cases where the listener protcol port is same as the peer port
and allowed_cidr set to 0.0.0.0/0 explicitly, the listener is not
provisioned due to duplicate security group creation for peer port
with None as remote_ip_prefix. Neutron SG defaults remote_ip_prefix
to 0.0.0.0/0 if not specified or None and hence the error SG rule
already exists.

Remove the duplicate entry from the updated_ports.

Story: #2009117
Change-Id: I9dbdb71e9b94bbcc75766a8687a996d5358f3381
(cherry picked from commit 151a94321074b1eda53d1a582fdf26942db85afd)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix duplicate SG creation for listener peer port

In cases where the listener protcol port is same as the peer port
and allowed_cidr set to 0.0.0.0/0 explicitly, the listener is not
provisioned due to duplicate security group creation for peer port
with None as remote_ip_prefix. Neutron SG defaults remote_ip_prefix
to 0.0.0.0/0 if not specified or None and hence the error SG rule
already exists.

Remove the duplicate entry from the updated_ports.

Story: #2009117
Change-Id: I9dbdb71e9b94bbcc75766a8687a996d5358f3381
(cherry picked from commit 151a94321074b1eda53d1a582fdf26942db85afd)

commit_message:
Fix duplicate SG creation for listener peer port

In cases where the listener protcol port is same as the peer port
and allowed_cidr set to 0.0.0.0/0 explicitly, the listener is not
provisioned due to duplicate security group creation for peer port
with None as remote_ip_prefix. Neutron SG defaults remote_ip_prefix
to 0.0.0.0/0 if not specified or None and hence the error SG rule
already exists.

Remove the duplicate entry from the updated_ports.

Story: #2009117
Change-Id: I9dbdb71e9b94bbcc75766a8687a996d5358f3381
(cherry picked from commit 151a94321074b1eda53d1a582fdf26942db85afd)

messages: [{'account_id': 16347, 'date': '2021-09-20 05:04:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-09-20 13:22:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-20 05:04:48.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting ACLs during Upgrade

Currently, we are setting file ACLs on /var/lib/neutron as part of
upgrade tasks if there is a neutron user in the system. Since moving to
containerized deployment, we don't have neutron user on the system
anymore. This code was added to resolve issues arising with existing
neutron resources when moving from system services to containerized
services.

This patch is to remove the stale upgrade tasks to remove file ACLs.

Closes-Bug: #1943034

Signed-off-by: Purandhar Sairam Mannidi <pmannidi@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I19f457a99dedfd781bd56987e3fea6626737500d
(cherry picked from commit a522941695e07d943c4908b4f403edf9d24f0108)
(cherry picked from commit b9fe05d56c4aa7645b900fc92bfac2f45da91c20)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting ACLs during Upgrade

Currently, we are setting file ACLs on /var/lib/neutron as part of
upgrade tasks if there is a neutron user in the system. Since moving to
containerized deployment, we don't have neutron user on the system
anymore. This code was added to resolve issues arising with existing
neutron resources when moving from system services to containerized
services.

This patch is to remove the stale upgrade tasks to remove file ACLs.

Closes-Bug: #1943034

Signed-off-by: Purandhar Sairam Mannidi <pmannidi@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I19f457a99dedfd781bd56987e3fea6626737500d
(cherry picked from commit a522941695e07d943c4908b4f403edf9d24f0108)
(cherry picked from commit b9fe05d56c4aa7645b900fc92bfac2f45da91c20)

commit_message:
Modify Placement Processing to Aspect definition

This patch will change the proccessing of Placement Constraints
from VDU name to Aspect Definition. There is also an error in the
judgment logic when setting Availavility_zone information from
the Zone information of GrantRes, so the judgment logic is also
fixed.

Closes-Bug: #1924216

subject: Fix occasional multinode-sol job FT error
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-20 16:36:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fix occasional multinode-sol job FT error

The "test_instantiate_terminate_vnf_with_vnflcmnoop" method of
multinode-sol job occasionally fails.
After vnf termination, "instantiationState" becomes "NOT_INSTANTIATED".
However, the "vnflcmOpOccs.operation_state" is not "COMPLETED" at this
point and sleep for 20 seconds before assert operation_state.
If stack deletion is not completed within 20 seconds sleep, reading
"PROCESSING" when asserting operation_state results in misjudgment
and an error.

This patch resolves the error by waiting until "COMPLETED" instead of
sleeping.

Co-authored-by: Ayumu Ueha <ueha.ayumu@fujitsu.com>
Signed-off-by: Yasufumi Ogawa <yasufum.o@gmail.com>
Change-Id: If64bb3c12e1d842e5bf497be683affcc7dbc95c4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix occasional multinode-sol job FT error

The "test_instantiate_terminate_vnf_with_vnflcmnoop" method of
multinode-sol job occasionally fails.
After vnf termination, "instantiationState" becomes "NOT_INSTANTIATED".
However, the "vnflcmOpOccs.operation_state" is not "COMPLETED" at this
point and sleep for 20 seconds before assert operation_state.
If stack deletion is not completed within 20 seconds sleep, reading
"PROCESSING" when asserting operation_state results in misjudgment
and an error.

This patch resolves the error by waiting until "COMPLETED" instead of
sleeping.

Co-authored-by: Ayumu Ueha <ueha.ayumu@fujitsu.com>
Signed-off-by: Yasufumi Ogawa <yasufum.o@gmail.com>
Change-Id: If64bb3c12e1d842e5bf497be683affcc7dbc95c4

subject: Fix status code for invalid filter conditions
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-20 16:21:50.000000000', 'message': "Fix status code for invalid filter conditions

The current tacker returns 500 Internal Server Error to requests with
invalid filter conditions where a VNFID is not UUID. However, as the
error is caused by a bad request, the status code should be 400.
This bug occurs because data types of 'id' and 'vnfd_Id' in TackerObject
are 'string' which don't match the data types in DB, i.e., UUID. In
order to fix this bug, those data types in TackerObject are changed to
'uuid'.

Closes-Bug: 1924666
Closes-Bug: 1926632

Co-authored-by: Tsukasa Inoue <inoue.tsk@nec.com>
Signed-off-by: Yasufumi Ogawa <yasufum.o@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I0ce99fa53f08feed47b898f3e8a3f7f87c2f1642
"}]
commit_message:
Fix status code for invalid filter conditions

The current tacker returns 500 Internal Server Error to requests with
invalid filter conditions where a VNFID is not UUID. However, as the
error is caused by a bad request, the status code should be 400.
This bug occurs because data types of 'id' and 'vnfd_Id' in TackerObject
are 'string' which don't match the data types in DB, i.e., UUID. In
order to fix this bug, those data types in TackerObject are changed to
'uuid'.

Closes-Bug: 1924666
Closes-Bug: 1926632

Co-authored-by: Tsukasa Inoue <inoue.tsk@nec.com>
Signed-off-by: Yasufumi Ogawa <yasufum.o@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I0ce99fa53f08feed47b898f3e8a3f7f87c2f1642

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3091fa393f006413aa371adfa87bc6275fb38415

commit_message:
Fix MAX_TIMEOUT value for listener

In the database, timeout_client_data, timeout_member_connect,
timeout_member_data, timeout_tcp_inspect have an integer type with
a maximum size of 2147483647. Now MAX_TIMEOUT in API does not exceed
this value and is equal to 24 days (2073600000 seconds).

Story: 2009193
Task: 43248
Change-Id: I990b6af1ff880b25e54f6c41ae0c966007f3f098
(cherry picked from commit 3a8f056306bba4502639bfc89752d8a48d694e7f)

commit_message:
Fix MAX_TIMEOUT value for listener

In the database, timeout_client_data, timeout_member_connect,
timeout_member_data, timeout_tcp_inspect have an integer type with
a maximum size of 2147483647. Now MAX_TIMEOUT in API does not exceed
this value and is equal to 24 days (2073600000 seconds).

Story: 2009193
Task: 43248
Change-Id: I990b6af1ff880b25e54f6c41ae0c966007f3f098
(cherry picked from commit 3a8f056306bba4502639bfc89752d8a48d694e7f)

commit_message:
Fix status code for invalid filter conditions

The current tacker returns 500 Internal Server Error to requests with
invalid filter conditions where a VNFID is not UUID. However, as the
error is caused by a bad request, the status code should be 400.

This bug occurs because data types of 'id' and 'vnfd_Id' in TackerObject
are 'string' which don't match the data types in DB, i.e., UUID. In
order to fix this bug, those data types in TackerObject are changed to
'uuid'.

Closes-Bug: 1924666
Closes-Bug: 1926632

Co-authored-by: Tsukasa Inoue <inoue.tsk@nec.com>
Signed-off-by: Yasufumi Ogawa <yasufum.o@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I568c218ab0d266e2f417d8b1eb81605f8c6f8ab3

commit_message:
Partial revert for tripleo-quickstart/+/791486 for centos7

This is a partial revert of [1] specifically for the centos7
case. We tested in the RDO testenv with [2] but it seems there is
some difference in the upstream which is causing related-bug.

This will allow us to unblock train while we consider how we can
use get-hash with centos7.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/791486
[2] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/testproject/+/35492

Related-Bug: 1943968
Change-Id: I010e57b9123d7694e35539619264d49d6a6cbc34

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-16 18:11:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fix distribution compatability for configdrive build

Previously, the configuration drive generation code made
use of ``genisoimage``, however ``genisoimage`` is not shipped
universally on all linux distributions, and largely has been
replaced in distributions with other forks, as the tooling has
evolved, forked, and changed over the past quarter century.

We now attempt to utilize multiple different commands, including
the original ``mkisofs`` command and the newer ``xorrisofs``
command when attempting to generate the ISO image, falling back
until one works.

Credit goes to I720f25921f8e52f20a631f238a528dedf65a91c6 for
the base pattern in OpenstackSDK.

Story: 2009230
Task: 43328
Change-Id: Ic732c2e6c77474e0d5b701c47758959c3511743b
(cherry picked from commit 0555b6ba728cc6a30f89d252eaf429ce5a0c987e)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix distribution compatability for configdrive build

Previously, the configuration drive generation code made
use of ``genisoimage``, however ``genisoimage`` is not shipped
universally on all linux distributions, and largely has been
replaced in distributions with other forks, as the tooling has
evolved, forked, and changed over the past quarter century.

We now attempt to utilize multiple different commands, including
the original ``mkisofs`` command and the newer ``xorrisofs``
command when attempting to generate the ISO image, falling back
until one works.

Credit goes to I720f25921f8e52f20a631f238a528dedf65a91c6 for
the base pattern in OpenstackSDK.

Story: 2009230
Task: 43328
Change-Id: Ic732c2e6c77474e0d5b701c47758959c3511743b
(cherry picked from commit 0555b6ba728cc6a30f89d252eaf429ce5a0c987e)

commit_message:
Add option to enable keystone in undercloud

As we're disabling keystone by default in the undercloud, this new
configuration option can be used to optionally enable keystone.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/799408

messages: [{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-09-10 15:32:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-09-20 15:02:37.000000000', 'content': 'Hashtag added: ironic-week-prio'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2021-09-20 15:20:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-10 15:32:48.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid using blkid in favour of lsblk and parted

Per blkid man page, we should rather use lsblk, which has much better
debugging output (blkid essentially only returns an exit code). Since
the partition table type is not available in lsblk, copy the procedure
using parted from ironic-python-agent.

Change-Id: I3b20754727de904dbe72f358a21f31f00a5fbb77
(cherry picked from commit b7f12117b96d984d95ac1f4ceee68d8a21dbde6c)
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid using blkid in favour of lsblk and parted

Per blkid man page, we should rather use lsblk, which has much better
debugging output (blkid essentially only returns an exit code). Since
the partition table type is not available in lsblk, copy the procedure
using parted from ironic-python-agent.

Change-Id: I3b20754727de904dbe72f358a21f31f00a5fbb77
(cherry picked from commit b7f12117b96d984d95ac1f4ceee68d8a21dbde6c)

commit_message:
Release openstackdocstheme 2.3.1

The StarlingX docs site utilizes a theme variant within the
openstackdocstheme repo, but consumes packaged releases. A recent
change merged to fix an issue with double heading, and the StarlingX
community would appreciate a new openstackdocstheme release to
make use of it.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-September/024917.html

Change-Id: I56755457df76321a503ae5cc86690215ce4168a1

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Icc008dfb0e5b412f1a2123275b8c0569502a0b0e

Run TripleO jobs on CentOS8 instead of CentOS7

As we are cleaning up the c7 jobs and obselete featuresets [1].
This change replaces usage of CentOS7 in TripleO jobs by CentOS8.

Task: 42892

[{'created': '2021-09-06 14:15:23.000000000', 'message': "haproxy: frontend/backend syntax in config

Ability to generate haproxy config with the frontend/backend
sections rather than the old listen section. This allows
the generation of complex configs, such as for example giving
priority to local backends when routing traffic.

Make the new syntax configurable via a new hiera key
`haproxy_backend_syntax`. The frontend and backend config of
each service can be further tweaked via additional keys
tripleo::haproxy::<service>::frontend_options and
tripleo::haproxy::<service>::backend_options

By default, keep the current 'listen' syntax.

Tested with capability disabled, the haproxy config generated
for undercloud and ha overcloud doesn't change.
Tested with capability enabled, tempest smoke test passed.

Closes-Bug: #1941617

Change-Id: Ieb36f90c6709934aa3aa6668d3929bff872c30f5
(cherry picked from commit 7a6c5281e0d75c54e298ce68b2a8b54eefc5f0f9)
(manually fixed conflicts for manifests/haproxy.pp)
"}, {'created': '2021-09-16 09:57:11.000000000', 'message': "haproxy: frontend/backend syntax in config

Ability to generate haproxy config with the frontend/backend
sections rather than the old listen section. This allows
the generation of complex configs, such as for example giving
priority to local backends when routing traffic.

Make the new syntax configurable via a new hiera key
`haproxy_backend_syntax`. The frontend and backend config of
each service can be further tweaked via additional keys
tripleo::haproxy::<service>::frontend_options and
tripleo::haproxy::<service>::backend_options

By default, keep the current 'listen' syntax.

Tested with capability disabled, the haproxy config generated
for undercloud and ha overcloud doesn't change.
Tested with capability enabled, tempest smoke test passed.

(Note: manually adapted healthcheck tests for neutron, cinder
and ironic to match stable/wallaby)

Closes-Bug: #1941617

Change-Id: Ieb36f90c6709934aa3aa6668d3929bff872c30f5
(cherry picked from commit 7a6c5281e0d75c54e298ce68b2a8b54eefc5f0f9)
(manually fixed conflicts for manifests/haproxy.pp)
"}]
commit_message:
haproxy: frontend/backend syntax in config

Ability to generate haproxy config with the frontend/backend
sections rather than the old listen section. This allows
the generation of complex configs, such as for example giving
priority to local backends when routing traffic.

Make the new syntax configurable via a new hiera key
`haproxy_backend_syntax`. The frontend and backend config of
each service can be further tweaked via additional keys
tripleo::haproxy::<service>::frontend_options and
tripleo::haproxy::<service>::backend_options

By default, keep the current 'listen' syntax.

Tested with capability disabled, the haproxy config generated
for undercloud and ha overcloud doesn't change.
Tested with capability enabled, tempest smoke test passed.

(Note: manually adapted healthcheck tests for neutron, cinder
and ironic to match stable/wallaby)

Closes-Bug: #1941617

Change-Id: Ieb36f90c6709934aa3aa6668d3929bff872c30f5
(cherry picked from commit 7a6c5281e0d75c54e298ce68b2a8b54eefc5f0f9)
(manually fixed conflicts for manifests/haproxy.pp)

commit_message:
Scaling down proposed instance count.

Unfortunately 50 instances on the current crashes out nova-compute.
Let's find a happy number, so the cloud is responsive. Setting to 40, but
anticipating that we may have to go even lower for consistency and responsiveness.

Change-Id: Ia726ed400bc881d1a97f0c39a05c481f38c6a0eb

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7999ee3a3a9a8a6cc55655fa255c5cedaf915445

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7999ee3a3a9a8a6cc55655fa255c5cedaf915445

Remove zaqar

overcloud for some time.

If 761195 is affected, then we may create a bug at least, this patch can't be rebased for that."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-03 14:46:31.000000000', 'message': "Use `ip route` for VIP configure with `onlink'

Otherwise, nexthop not from subnet cidr will fail.

Problem: Neutron allows to set subnet's
host_routes parameter with any gateway,
even with that's not in subnet's CIDR.
In this case we'll get error:
`{u'message': u'Error plugging VIP', u'details':
u'SIOCADDRT: Network is unreachable\nFailed to bring up eth1.\n'}`.

- Use modern `ip route` tool (+ it allows to set /32 subnets
   without additional conditions)
- Set `onlink` to allow any gateway

Signed-off-by: George Melikov <mail@gmelikov.ru>
Change-Id: I4ccf212b9e82930bf0e02b4546ad2a0a58975e20
"}, {'created': '2021-06-04 08:47:56.000000000', 'message': "Use `ip route` for VIP configure with `onlink'

Otherwise, nexthop not from subnet cidr will fail.

Problem: Neutron allows to set subnet's
host_routes parameter with any gateway,
even with that's not in subnet's CIDR.
In this case we'll get error:
`{u'message': u'Error plugging VIP', u'details':
u'SIOCADDRT: Network is unreachable\nFailed to bring up eth1.\n'}`.

- Use modern `ip route` tool (+ it allows to set /32 subnets
   without additional conditions)
- Set `onlink` to allow any gateway

Story: 2008944
Task: 42563
Signed-off-by: George Melikov <mail@gmelikov.ru>
Change-Id: I4ccf212b9e82930bf0e02b4546ad2a0a58975e20
"}]
commit_message:
Use `ip route` for VIP configure with `onlink'

Otherwise, nexthop not from subnet cidr will fail.

Problem: Neutron allows to set subnet's
host_routes parameter with any gateway,
even with that's not in subnet's CIDR.
In this case we'll get error:
`{u'message': u'Error plugging VIP', u'details':
u'SIOCADDRT: Network is unreachable\nFailed to bring up eth1.\n'}`.

- Use modern `ip route` tool (+ it allows to set /32 subnets
   without additional conditions)
- Set `onlink` to allow any gateway

Story: 2008944
Task: 42563
Signed-off-by: George Melikov <mail@gmelikov.ru>
Change-Id: I4ccf212b9e82930bf0e02b4546ad2a0a58975e20

commit_message:
Use qemu-nbd instead of kpartx, handle whole-disk image

This change switches to using qemu-nbd instead of kpartx to unify with
documentation on what tool to use for mount based image
modifications[1].

This change also handles whole-disk images. The script is actually an
inlined version of these scripts which will be packaged with
tripleo-common[2]. This inline script can be replaced with
tripleo-mount-image as soon as it is packaged

Blueprint: whole-disk-default
[1] https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_openstack_platform/16.1/html/bare_metal_provisioning/booting-from-cinder-volumes
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/806067

Change-Id: I088bcf7a537d761565faaaa297114f4f0f609f7e

Attempting to use LIBS_FROM_GIT="ALL" results in a failure
due to a typo in stackrc for os-resource-classes repo.

  Cloning into '/opt/stack/os-resource-classes'...
  fatal: protocol ':-https' is not supported
  <snip>
  [ERROR] /opt/stack/devstack/functions-common:629 git call failed: [git clone :-https://opendev.org/openstack/os-resource-classes.git /opt/stack/os-resource-classes --branch master]

Remove the extraneous '='.

Change-Id: I21f86324dc15fe808b38e366f7af18c96fd3890c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix stackrc os-resource-classes typo

Attempting to use LIBS_FROM_GIT="ALL" results in a failure
due to a typo in stackrc for os-resource-classes repo.

  Cloning into '/opt/stack/os-resource-classes'...
  fatal: protocol ':-https' is not supported
  <snip>
  [ERROR] /opt/stack/devstack/functions-common:629 git call failed: [git clone :-https://opendev.org/openstack/os-resource-classes.git /opt/stack/os-resource-classes --branch master]

Remove the extraneous '='.

Change-Id: I21f86324dc15fe808b38e366f7af18c96fd3890c

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-03 07:10:59.000000000', 'message': 'Remove name parameter from cell export

Initially the idea was to have for each cell export information
for the additional cell to deploy. The name of the new cell
is provided to the export command to create the export file
name, if not specified via --output-file.
Since the exported information is not in all cases specific to
the new cell and can be shared with multiple cells, it does
not make sense to have the new cell name as a required parameter.
Lets remove the name parameter is it is right now that the
export information file name is generic to be used for multiple
cells.

Change-Id: If8b15fd206a32dbd5b2edb1cd500f4e2151313d9
(cherry picked from commit f10842848b03aa652a50d04ce4732356300736f4)
(cherry picked from commit 035f9b6a29240cc9a6c17a5b4f09618199724f92)
(cherry picked from commit 456dc483ff03452983fd2b4fcc0585d5ed701aca)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove name parameter from cell export

Initially the idea was to have for each cell export information
for the additional cell to deploy. The name of the new cell
is provided to the export command to create the export file
name, if not specified via --output-file.
Since the exported information is not in all cases specific to
the new cell and can be shared with multiple cells, it does
not make sense to have the new cell name as a required parameter.
Lets remove the name parameter is it is right now that the
export information file name is generic to be used for multiple
cells.

Change-Id: If8b15fd206a32dbd5b2edb1cd500f4e2151313d9
(cherry picked from commit f10842848b03aa652a50d04ce4732356300736f4)
(cherry picked from commit 035f9b6a29240cc9a6c17a5b4f09618199724f92)
(cherry picked from commit 456dc483ff03452983fd2b4fcc0585d5ed701aca)

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Fix for GVG snapshot delete

If a Generic Volume Group (PowerMax storage group) has volumes
added or removed from it since a group snapshot was taken, the
deletion of this group snapshot will fail unless a force flag
is supplied.

Change-Id: I97bdc54e41aa51bf44e986cc1779b92acea2b47d

commit_message:
Run TripleO jobs on CentOS8 instead of CentOS7

As we are cleaning up the c7 jobs and obselete featuresets [1].
This change replaces usage of CentOS7 in TripleO jobs by CentOS8.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22cleanup_featuresets%22+(status:open%20OR%20status:merged)

Change-Id: Ic4f40170517a1137239091a5629007d47fa91810

commit_message:
coordination: Allow disabling management of backend package

... which is already implemented in other resources like oslo::cache.

commit_message:
cache: support etcd3gw backend

This change introduces support to use ectd3gw backend as oslo.cache
backend, and makes the required backend package installed. The same
backend is already supported for coordination and this change leverage
the existing definitions added for coordination.

Change-Id: Id0eec018a68ab4a510307f150aa2a6ee017fa651

commit_message:
cache: Allow customizing status of the backend package

This change introduces the package_ensure parameter to oslo::cache
resource type, so that users can define status of the backend package.

Change-Id: I34f10b51e1179beed327b9544b0899105cb30895

commit_message:
Add extension fwaas_v2 based on neutron-api relation data

fwaas_v2 extension is added in l3_agent.ini by default from stein.
However with the newly introduced neutron-api configuration parameter
enable-fwaas, the extension have to added only when it is set to true
on neutron-api charm.

neutron-api charm adds enabled-fwaas as relation data in the commit
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-neutron-api/+/806676.
This patch removes special handling of fwaas_v2 as l3_extension_plugins
is already updated in relation data based on neutron-api enable-fwaas
configuration.

Add python3-neutron-fwaas in py3 package list only for rocky release. The
package is already part of dependency of neutron-l3-agent until Ussuri
release and the dependency will be removed from Victoria release in
package control files.

Synced charmhelpers to get related changes
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/640

Closes-Bug: #1934129
Change-Id: I1546f45635bfd7af76001c1df4f99d219a9d8039
(cherry picked from commit d3daa09bc49bcc5c66791565e1720a9a484ea149)

[{'created': '2021-08-31 01:13:10.000000000', 'message': 'Use safe shim binary paths on redhat family

The path /boot/efi/EFI/BOOT/BOOTX64.EFI is probably the packaged
signed shim binary but it could be any bootloader binary from another
OS on a dual-boot system.

The shim packages also place the same binary at
/boot/efi/EFI/<distro>/shimx64.efi, so this change switches to using
that path instead.

Change-Id: I450af490ee149a268cd5fb6727010834262de1f6
'}, {'created': '2021-09-15 23:07:53.000000000', 'message': 'Use safe shim binary paths on redhat family

The path /boot/efi/EFI/BOOT/BOOTX64.EFI is probably the packaged
signed shim binary but it could be any bootloader binary from another
OS on a dual-boot system.

The shim packages also place the same binary at
/boot/efi/EFI/<distro>/shimx64.efi, so this change switches to using
that path instead.

Change-Id: I450af490ee149a268cd5fb6727010834262de1f6
'}]
commit_message:
Use safe shim binary paths on redhat family

The path /boot/efi/EFI/BOOT/BOOTX64.EFI is probably the packaged
signed shim binary but it could be any bootloader binary from another
OS on a dual-boot system.

The shim packages also place the same binary at
/boot/efi/EFI/<distro>/shimx64.efi, so this change switches to using
that path instead.

Change-Id: I450af490ee149a268cd5fb6727010834262de1f6

commit_message:
Keystone: deprecate the separate admin service

It's not needed since Identity v3 and only consumes resources. Deprecate
it with the intention to drop it in Yoga.

Change-Id: I477042af86263422ea12f6e9bf710bfff89e36c4

commit_message:
Add uWSGI role and use systemd instead of emperor mode

Using the emperor mode of uWSGI is redundant now that we depend on
systemd. This change switches uWSGI Keystone to systemd template services
based on the recipe from the uWSGI documentation [1].

A new role is created to encapsulate the uWSGI login in anticipation of
switching Ironic API to uWSGI as well. Reduce repetition in Keystone.

[1] https://uwsgi-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Systemd.html

Change-Id: I50bc3f7a4faf14c36b92e7656b7149e9c833c85e

commit_message:
CI: Log disk usage details

Five levels of depth gives us details about each Docker volume. Remove
files or directories smaller than 1MB from the output to keep it short.

Change-Id: I300e37106ab4dc2ebfa70371391c99cd43c7b14c

subject: Run TripleO jobs on CentOS8 instead of CentOS7
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-17 11:46:30.000000000', 'message': 'Run TripleO jobs on CentOS8 instead of CentOS7

As we are cleaning up the c7 jobs and obselete featuresets [1].
This change replaces usage of CentOS7 in TripleO jobs by CentOS8.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22cleanup_featuresets%22+(status:open%20OR%20status:merged)

Change-Id: Ic4f40170517a1137239091a5629007d47fa91810
'}]
commit_message:
Run TripleO jobs on CentOS8 instead of CentOS7

As we are cleaning up the c7 jobs and obselete featuresets [1].
This change replaces usage of CentOS7 in TripleO jobs by CentOS8.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22cleanup_featuresets%22+(status:open%20OR%20status:merged)

Change-Id: Ic4f40170517a1137239091a5629007d47fa91810

commit_message:
Release barbican-tempest-plugin for xena

barbican-tempest-plugin is a tempest plugin. This patch propose a latest release for
barbican-tempest-plugin to get any merged changes out prior to the final Xena going
into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Thursday, September 23.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 1.4.0..8400a79
8400a79 Add secure-rbac tests for Quotas across projects
e20bc47 Enforce scope in RBAC testing
ced0ebe Add secure-rbac tests for Orders across projects
d47ae42 Refactor orders cleanup
4e5e457 Add secure-rbac test for Containers
087f89d Add secure-rbac test for Secrets across projects
62baff3 Refactor secret cleanup
6d4e995 Let the orders complete before using them

Signed-off-by: HervÃ© Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iaa19b521ea74cc4c56772f885d411414f2ef91c1

commit_message:
Support more agent specific report_interval

This change introduces the report_interval parameters to more agent
classes, so that users can override report interval of a specific
agent more flexibly.

Change-Id: I573d1f9abe201bdd17bf16602218252cc9b7f132

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-16 11:50:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix front/back-end options

Follow the rule:
 - *log is only needed for frontend usually (by default)
 - tcpka and other "durability" related options are set for both
   sides, based on a service case by case
 - move the frontend-only options, like 'client X' to frontend hashes
 - move the backend-only options, like 'server Y' to backend hashes

Change-Id: I3fd753fc3a4522faf565999a019df0f4095ebd9c
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2021-09-17 09:19:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix front/back-end options

Follow the rule:
 - *log is only needed for frontend usually (by default)
 - tcpka and other "durability" related options are set for both
   sides, based on a service case by case
 - move the frontend-only options, like 'client X' to frontend hashes
 - move the backend-only options, like 'server Y' to backend hashes

Change-Id: I3fd753fc3a4522faf565999a019df0f4095ebd9c
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix front/back-end options

Follow the rule:
 - *log is only needed for frontend usually (by default)
 - tcpka and other "durability" related options are set for both
   sides, based on a service case by case
 - move the frontend-only options, like 'client X' to frontend hashes
 - move the backend-only options, like 'server Y' to backend hashes

Change-Id: I3fd753fc3a4522faf565999a019df0f4095ebd9c
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove jobs corresponds to obselete featuresets

As we are removing the jobs which are using the obselete featuresets [1]
so removing those jobs from templates/layouts.
And this project is no longer maintained.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22cleanup_featuresets%22+(status:open%20OR%20status:merged)

Change-Id: I959ca9795e753051e03be1f9000e50b13517ee72

messages: [{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-09-04 12:50:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-09-04 12:56:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-09-09 16:03:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2021-09-20 06:01:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-04 12:50:50.000000000', 'message': "Delete policy file if policies hash is empty

If all policies get deleted, previously created policy files won't
get removed and the api policy file is still used. Let's make
sure the policy file gets purged if the policies hash is empty.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/802305
Change-Id: Ia4e3b30c1ad7b9aaae2bd9377a539c77899c4f47
"}, {'created': '2021-09-04 12:56:51.000000000', 'message': 'Allow purging policy files

This change introduces the new purge_config parameter to the policy
class so that any policy rules not managed by puppet manifests can be
cleared.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/802305
Change-Id: Ia4e3b30c1ad7b9aaae2bd9377a539c77899c4f47
'}]
commit_message:
Allow purging policy files

This change introduces the new purge_config parameter to the policy
class so that any policy rules not managed by puppet manifests can be
cleared.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/802305
Change-Id: Ia4e3b30c1ad7b9aaae2bd9377a539c77899c4f47

commit_message:
test demonstrating working shard policy migration

The shard policy migration is using the same criteria as the root for
deciding when to migrate to a new policy. This can only result in
permanent policy agreement between the root and shard.

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistairncoles@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix how disallow_iframe_embed is defined

The disallow_iframe_embed option doesn't belong to HORIZON_CONFIG but
should be described as a variable in local_settings.

Closes-Bug: #1942722
Change-Id: I189fbb0a76ba63e16f6c3b6ad9db6f9e0355617f

commit_message:
CredentialsV3: Ensure all attributes are cleared by unset

Currently the unset method only clears attributes defined in the base
Crednetial class and ones specific to CredentialV3 are left set.
This change ensures the method clears all attributes.

Closes-Bug: #1942145
Change-Id: I4bddbf9bb3c6251aa8b68a8bc2ef8799f3c8065e

commit_message:
Add extension fwaas_v2 based on neutron-api relation data

fwaas_v2 extension is added in l3_agent.ini by default from stein.
However with the newly introduced neutron-api configuration parameter
enable-fwaas, the extension have to added only when it is set to true
on neutron-api charm.

neutron-api charm adds enabled-fwaas as relation data in the commit
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-neutron-api/+/806676.
This patch removes special handling of fwaas_v2 as l3_extension_plugins
is already updated in relation data based on neutron-api enable-fwaas
configuration.

Remove python3-neutron-fwaas in package list from stein release. The
package is already part of dependency of neutron-l3-agent until Ussuri
release and the dependency will be removed from Victoria release in
package control files.

Synced charmhelpers to get related changes
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/640

Partial-Bug: #1934129
Change-Id: I07db7fb7c2f00eaf4c0a5bcc082c73922b87d1c0
(cherry picked from commit de22d6cbe2d9755048019674b8be1a4d11280649)

commit_message:
Allow purging policy files

This change introduces the new purge_config parameter to the policy
class so that any policy rules not managed by puppet manifests can be
cleared.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/802305

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-15 15:45:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fix online data migrations

Online data migrations are part of the rolling upgrades mechanism, and
they are run on the current installed version before we upgrade to the
next one to ensure that all DB records have been upgraded even if they
have not been accessed during the life of the current release service
life.

This means that online migrations from one release should be removed on
the next release, as they are no longer needed.

We still have the Queens online data migrations in our code, and we
should remove them in master, Stein, and Rocky.

This patch also adds checks to the status tool to check that these
online data migrations have completed.

Closes-bug: #1837703

commit_message:
Fix online data migrations

Online data migrations are part of the rolling upgrades mechanism, and
they are run on the current installed version before we upgrade to the
next one to ensure that all DB records have been upgraded even if they
have not been accessed during the life of the current release service
life.

This means that online migrations from one release should be removed on
the next release, as they are no longer needed.

We still have the Queens online data migrations in our code, and we
should remove them in master, Stein, and Rocky.

This patch also adds checks to the status tool to check that these
online data migrations have completed.

Closes-bug: #1837703
Change-Id: I025789f92eb318b8e5a531bea6cf106d52f268ae
(cherry picked from commit 230bda82c1ada91dcec90b21913d713795164b19)
(cherry picked from commit 83b83256142cff920b8e33efca540e6cefe18c0c)

commit_message:
Update the section of quota parameters

Since the dependent patch was merged, all quota parameters are defined
under [quota] section instead of [DEFAULT] section. This change updates
the section used accordingly.

Related-Bug: #1934025

commit_message:
Allow purging policy files

This change introduces the new purge_config parameter to the policy
class so that any policy rules not managed by puppet manifests can be
cleared.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/802305
Change-Id: I852a164417f9c782a518b8df0ae146eefd28e719

commit_message:
Allow purging policy files

This change introduces the new purge_config parameter to the policy
class so that any policy rules not managed by puppet manifests can be
cleared.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/802305
Change-Id: I741dd24afdd9b6108b0876d8d378bafe81d2b69f

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Id9d65aebe9aae848901cd25d39ef53a0aea80081

commit_message:
[SVF] Fix extend issue for mirroring volumes

[Spectrum Virtualize Family] Fixed volume extend issue for volumes
with replication enabled by avoiding both delete RC relationship
and create RC relationship of that volume.

Closes-Bug: #1920870

Change-Id: Id8dfa3d756142a17a50edf969d2ec84cfe524f4f

commit_message:
Add environment to enable keystone in undercloud

As we're disabling keystone by default, this would be needed
if there is a need to enable it.

Change-Id: I9bc8116c85f710ecc83eb8254b45fa2d48f59424

> Patch Set 10:
> 
> Is there a way to disable deploying without keystone?

> Patch Set 10:
>

> > 
> > Is there a way to disable deploying without keystone?
> > I tought conensus on spec was that removing keystone may remove a "tick" in the box security audit thing and this should be optional?
> 
> Yes I'll add an environment to enable it and tripleoclient changes to add 'enable_keystone' flag (we don't have one atm).

This is proposed as the default (we use http_basic auth for ironic for the security concerns raised), but there would be an option to enable keystone.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-07-04 02:24:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-07-04 12:40:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

commit_message:
Deploy standalone ironic and neutron in undercloud

This makes the following changes:

- Create cloud.yaml for undercloud with standalone services
- Remove keystone and memcached from the undercloud

Change-Id: I741123dcbf4544845b40e253d8b42d868317cc03
