[{'created': '2021-09-16 17:35:34.000000000', 'message': 'Return "overcloud status" output without debug

Currently, "openstack overcloud status" without debug
returns nothing if overcloud stack is not available.

~~~
$ openstack overcloud status
$
~~~

This was not the case in ussuri[0] and older branches,

Till ussuri :-
~~~
$ openstack overcloud status
No deployment was found for overcloud
~~~

With this patch, We are improvining the user experience
incase no overcloud deployment is found.

[0] https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/src/branch/stable/ussuri/tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py#L1198-L1200

Closes-bug: #1943855
Change-Id: Ice40c5000fa3ef22cacdb4ddb0c32bda245245b0
'}]
commit_message:
Return "overcloud status" output without debug

Currently, "openstack overcloud status" without debug
returns nothing if overcloud stack is not available.

~~~
$ openstack overcloud status
$
~~~

This was not the case in ussuri[0] and older branches,

Till ussuri :-
~~~
$ openstack overcloud status
No deployment was found for overcloud
~~~

With this patch, We are improvining the user experience
incase no overcloud deployment is found.

[0] https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/src/branch/stable/ussuri/tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py#L1198-L1200

Closes-bug: #1943855
Change-Id: Ice40c5000fa3ef22cacdb4ddb0c32bda245245b0

messages: [{'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2021-07-20 11:10:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-09-02 12:39:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-09-16 10:36:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-09-17 08:55:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-20 11:10:38.000000000', 'message': "Support setting docker registry credentials to the empty string

The use case is that I want to set these credentials via extra vars
like this:

  kayobe overcloud container image build test -e kolla_docker_registry_username=$HARBOR_REGISTRY_USER -e kolla_docker_registry_password=$HARBOR_REGISTRY_PASSWORD

Supporting the empty string means that I don't need to use any
conditional logic.

Change-Id: Ie5c21597266c8e470994eba16f3c2ed2224d0dcb
"}]
commit_message:
Support setting docker registry credentials to the empty string

The use case is that I want to set these credentials via extra vars
like this:

  kayobe overcloud container image build test -e kolla_docker_registry_username=$HARBOR_REGISTRY_USER -e kolla_docker_registry_password=$HARBOR_REGISTRY_PASSWORD

Supporting the empty string means that I don't need to use any
conditional logic.

Change-Id: Ie5c21597266c8e470994eba16f3c2ed2224d0dcb

commit_message:
Remove jobs corresponds to obselete featuresets

As we are removing the jobs which are using the obselete featuresets [1]
so removing those jobs from templates/layouts.
And this project is no longer maintained.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22cleanup_featuresets%22+(status:open%20OR%20status:merged)

Change-Id: I959ca9795e753051e03be1f9000e50b13517ee72

commit_message:
Remove jobs corresponds to obselete featuresets

As we are removing the jobs which are using the obselete featuresets [1]
so removing those jobs from templates/layouts.
And this project is no longer maintained.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22cleanup_featuresets%22+(status:open%20OR%20status:merged)

Change-Id: I959ca9795e753051e03be1f9000e50b13517ee72

commit_message:
Update instructions of installing k8s VIM

The current `Kubernetes VIM installation` page has some
out-of-date instructions.

This patch replaces those out-of-date instructions with current
kubernetes manner, and fixes some other trivial mistakes
in the document.

Change-Id: I3d37aa215a9629f4ded92d0b4cb1b930658a2113
Signed-off-by: Masaki UENO <masaki.ueno.up@hco.ntt.co.jp>

across OpenStack projects.

commit_message:
Implement Xena project personas for group snapshots

This commit introduces secure RBAC by updating the group snapshot APIs
to consume default roles.

Also removes the following policies from test/unit/policy.yaml:
-"group:get_all_group_snapshots": ""
-"group:get_group_snapshot": ""
-"group:delete_group_snapshot": ""
-"group:update_group_snapshot": ""

Co-Authored-by: Lance Bragstad <lbragstad@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-by: Sofia Enriquez <lsofia.enriquez@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ia6e7ef461c8284a4ee3182773add3c9c3e99791b

commit_message:
ADD venus for kolla-ansible

This project can provide a one-stop solution to log collection,
cleaning, indexing, analysis, alarm, visualization, report generation
and other needs, which involves helping operator or maintainer to
quickly solve retrieve problems, grasp the operational health of the
platform, and improve the level of platform management.

https: //wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Venus
Change-Id: I6289775c9566174d6551c0622ffabefd95631799

commit_message:
Fix gate

and a related script.

pydot2 is not maintained and stopped being installable.
pydot is maintained and seems to work the same.

Change-Id: Id248d2349c31b4cb4ad82c2afde10787c75081c7

commit_message:
Private registry for deploying Kubernetes cluster

This patch implements spec
Support deployed Kubernetes cluster using the images in a Docker
private registry with MgmtDriver in blueprint bp/cir-k8s-cluster.

It includes mgmt_driver scripts of deploying a Docker private
registry to vm created by openstack_driver.
Support instantiate/terminate/heal function.

It includes mgmt_driver scripts of deploying kubernetes cluster
that can use images in Docker private registry to vm created by
openstack_driver.
Support instantiate/terminate/scale/heal function.

It also includes a shell script that actual install kubernetes
cluster and configure environment to support Docker private registry
on vm.

Implements: blueprint cir-k8s-cluster
Change-Id: I7adab1d1eaa491a37399d0b615cbee4c6ae86657

>> This test case inherits base.BaseTackerTest. Do you mean we need to change the inheritance source, or do multiple inheritance?

Line\xa0521

This file contains only FT for TOSCA, so I think the test function name should be 'test_inst_chgextconn_term'.
>> Changes done in patchset 2

Line\xa01126
Do you need these confirmations?
>> Not required so, removed in patchset 2

Line\xa01173
What is this sleep for? If you have a reason, please add a supplement in NOTE. Also, is 10 seconds appropriate?
>> In _change_ext_conn_vnf_instance, it is finished after finishing update of stack. At this time, LCM operation status doesn't shift to COMPLETE immediately, so sleeping process was added to avoid conflict with Termination process. It is avoidable to sleep during 2 or 3 sec., but set 10 sec as enough time.



tacker/vnfm/infra_drivers/openstack/openstack.py

commit_message:
Support TOSCA route for ChgExternalConnectivity

Current ChangeExternalConnectivity operation only supports
user data case, we will improve such operation to support
TOSCA route.

Implements: blueprint support-change-external-connectivity
Change-Id: I5f03b27ddcbad883317d9817c08af7e59cb327f0

commit_message:
Add enable-fwaas to relation data

Add enable-fwaas to neutron-plugin-api relation data so
that neutron-openvswitch updates neutron-l3-agent
configuration accordingly.

Synced charmhelpers to get related changes
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/640

Partial-Bug: #1934129

(cherry picked from commit 69af89a6158679e87d9b6c2a437268b725fbcd80)
Change-Id: I5019c5ed3b8ab556d4900f1fe46dee69f5f09ee7

commit_message:
[community goal] Update contributor documentation

This patch updates/adds the contributor documentation to follow
the guidelines of the Ussuri cycle community goal[1].

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/project-ptl-and-contrib-docs.html

Story: #2007236
Task: #38543
Change-Id: If8c73e980db1a8a2475c21684bf630156d6fb8dd

commit_message:
Add groups under topology_template in vnf_dict

This patch will include `groups` in `topology_template`
of `vnf_dict`.

Closes-Bug: #1929811
Change-Id: Ic05b58a2c4a605459822936b21a87a97b1899ce5

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-30 07:03:05.000000000', 'message': 'Sample script for healing k8s with kubespray

This patch and "Sample script for deploying k8s with kubespray",
"Sample script for scaling k8s with kubespray" are actually the
same one. For the convenience of review, they
were submitted separately.

This patch is only about the content of heal k8s nodes. However,
since the processing of scale_start is similar to heal_start,
and the processing of scale_end is similar to the processing of
heal_end, the code of scale has been refactored and the common
processing is extracted as a common method. At the same time,
when CNF needs to perform `heal_entire`, the configuration file
of Load Balancer needs to be re-modified, so heal-related
processing is added to the example MgmtDriver of CNF's `NodePort`.

Because the input parameter of terminate and heal is limited,
the type of this parameter is also modified. in
`NFV-SOL003 v2.6.1`[1], the `additionalParams`'s type is
`KeyValuePairs`, so we changed the additionalParams's type from
`list` to `dict` in heal_vnf_request. In order not to affect
the original function, we modified the original additional_params
to legacy_additional_params and retained the original processing,
and revised the UT code.

[1] https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_gs/NFV-SOL/001_099/003/02.06.01_60/gs_NFV-SOL003v020601p.pdf

Implements: blueprint k8s-mgmtdriver-kubespray
Change-Id: Ibf8b56904b1326f5c7d323c9295d10e303f4b4b8

commit_message:
Sample script for healing k8s with kubespray

This patch and "Sample script for deploying k8s with kubespray",
"Sample script for scaling k8s with kubespray" are actually the
same one. For the convenience of review, they
were submitted separately.

This patch is only about the content of heal k8s nodes. However,
since the processing of scale_start is similar to heal_start,
and the processing of scale_end is similar to the processing of
heal_end, the code of scale has been refactored and the common
processing is extracted as a common method. At the same time,
when CNF needs to perform `heal_entire`, the configuration file
of Load Balancer needs to be re-modified, so heal-related
processing is added to the example MgmtDriver of CNF's `NodePort`.

Because the input parameter of terminate and heal is limited,
the type of this parameter is also modified. In
`NFV-SOL003 v2.6.1`[1], the `additionalParams`'s type is
`KeyValuePairs`, so we changed the additionalParams's type from
`list` to `dict` in heal_vnf_request. In order not to affect
the original function, we modified the original additional_params
to legacy_additional_params and retained the original processing,
and revised the UT code.

[1] https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_gs/NFV-SOL/001_099/003/02.06.01_60/gs_NFV-SOL003v020601p.pdf

Implements: blueprint k8s-mgmtdriver-kubespray
Change-Id: Ibf8b56904b1326f5c7d323c9295d10e303f4b4b8

commit_message:
Sample script for scaling k8s with kubespray

This patch and "Sample script for deploying k8s with kubespray"
are actually the same one. For the convenience of review, they
were submitted separately.

This patch is only about the content of scale k8s nodes. Since
the content of `NodePort` is not involved when scaling CNF,
there is no need to modify the configuration of Load Balancer.

The type of input parameter `additionalParams` of
ScaleVnfRequest is `DictOfStringsField`. The type of Kubernetes
cluster parameters used in MgmtDriver is dict, `DictOfStringsField`
type cannot adapt it. So we modify the type of additionalParams to
`DictOfNullableField`.

Implements: blueprint k8s-mgmtdriver-kubespray
Change-Id: Ib5e009c53dd834624d91ea38c9facba832d65d2b

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-15 21:00:37.000000000', 'message': 'Dial back gate job memory allocation

Observed an OOM incident causing
ironic-tempest-ipa-partition-pxe_ipmitool to fail.

One vm started, the other seemed to try to start twice, but both times
stopped shortly into the run and the base OS had recorded in it an OOM
failure.

It appears the actual QEMU memory footprint being consumed when
configured at 3GB is upwards of 4GB, which obviously is too big to
fit in our 8GB VM instance.

Dialing back slightly, in hopes it stabilizes the job.

Change-Id: Id8cef722ed305e96d89b9960a8f60f751f900221
'}]
commit_message:
Dial back gate job memory allocation

Observed an OOM incident causing
ironic-tempest-ipa-partition-pxe_ipmitool to fail.

One vm started, the other seemed to try to start twice, but both times
stopped shortly into the run and the base OS had recorded in it an OOM
failure.

It appears the actual QEMU memory footprint being consumed when
configured at 3GB is upwards of 4GB, which obviously is too big to
fit in our 8GB VM instance.

Dialing back slightly, in hopes it stabilizes the job.

Change-Id: Id8cef722ed305e96d89b9960a8f60f751f900221

Just wondering, we've seen numerous issues with subports never becoming ACTIVE after being attached to trunk. Could we update the status the same way?"}, {'account_id': 33145, 'date': '2021-09-14 12:28:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> 
> Just wondering, we've seen numerous issues with subports never becoming ACTIVE after being attached to trunk. Could we update the status the same way?

I am afraid not. The status is to track subport is being treated successfully. This is not the right place to update port status.

This mechenism is to tag subport has been bound or unbound from trunk with trunk informaiton in port attribtues. And in this stage, port status cannot be decided yet."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-09-17 07:54:38.000000000', 'content': 'Created a revert of this change as Ia042384e0ac333f30235b76e50fdc8748fc2b29a'}]

commit_message:
update subport status when trunk/subport create/delete is triggerred

When trunk or subport is created or deleted, notifications are sent. In
the meanwhile, subport status is not updated accordingly.

device_id device_owner and binding:host_id should be updated when
notifications are received.

In this patch, notifications are listened and subport status should be
updated when trunk/subport is created and subport is already added to
trunk:

    device_id: <trunk_id>
    device_owner: trunk:subport
    binding:host_id: <parent port host_id>

When trunk/subport is deleted or subport is removed from trunk, subport
status should be updated:

    device_id: None
    device_owner: None
    binding:host_id: None

Closes-Bug: #1942413
Change-Id: I0bdc5aabae0125926253b530fd0c6e79ba7bcbb9

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-23 13:51:55.000000000', 'message': 'SF: Handle qos values on extend volume

For the Solidfire cinder driver when volume extend is called on a volume
that has a qos with scaledIOPs=True, the values scaleMin, scaleMax,
scaleBurst are ignored, thus when a volume grows the iops values stay
the same when they should either grow or shrink.

To correct the bug _retrieve_qos_setting has a new argument size with a
default value of zero. This allows all previous calls to function
properly, and saved duplicating code.

Extend volume now calls _retrive_qos_settings with the new size argument
and then includes that qos with the call to solidfire api  ModifyVolume.

Closes-Bug: #1783588
Change-Id: I8cb7b1eccbc63ef4077e86324afdd1a11409343d
(cherry picked from commit 12a7bf699df1558f081513b1686d9c389bd3b812)
(cherry picked from commit 6bcb6fea741267b72175e5936c6f6a656fb2fffc)
'}]
commit_message:
SF: Handle qos values on extend volume

For the Solidfire cinder driver when volume extend is called on a volume
that has a qos with scaledIOPs=True, the values scaleMin, scaleMax,
scaleBurst are ignored, thus when a volume grows the iops values stay
the same when they should either grow or shrink.

To correct the bug _retrieve_qos_setting has a new argument size with a
default value of zero. This allows all previous calls to function
properly, and saved duplicating code.

Extend volume now calls _retrive_qos_settings with the new size argument
and then includes that qos with the call to solidfire api  ModifyVolume.

Closes-Bug: #1783588
Change-Id: I8cb7b1eccbc63ef4077e86324afdd1a11409343d
(cherry picked from commit 12a7bf699df1558f081513b1686d9c389bd3b812)
(cherry picked from commit 6bcb6fea741267b72175e5936c6f6a656fb2fffc)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-16 10:41:32.000000000', 'message': "Add defaults overcloud_image as overcloud-full

In patch [1] we removed the hard-code overcloud-full image name,
but the default var is only set in tqe[2] not tq. This leads to
oooq deployment failing on convert-image task with
error: 'overcloud_image' is undefined

Adding in `overcloud_image` var in tq common role defaults to
resolves the Bug mentioned in Closes-Bug.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/801703
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/src/branch/master/roles/extras-common/defaults/main.yml#L170

Closes-Bug: #1943820
Change-Id: I075e168a9cc10b76841ef93af0e54c6abf48dd76
"}]
commit_message:
Add defaults overcloud_image as overcloud-full

In patch [1] we removed the hard-code overcloud-full image name,
but the default var is only set in tqe[2] not tq. This leads to
oooq deployment failing on convert-image task with
error: 'overcloud_image' is undefined

Adding in `overcloud_image` var in tq common role defaults to
resolves the Bug mentioned in Closes-Bug.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/801703
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/src/branch/master/roles/extras-common/defaults/main.yml#L170

Closes-Bug: #1943820
Change-Id: I075e168a9cc10b76841ef93af0e54c6abf48dd76

subject: We probably don't need upper constraints for doc
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}, {'_account_id': 9976, 'name': 'Ronelle Landy', 'email': 'rlandy@redhat.com', 'username': 'rlandy'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 32926, 'name': 'Jiri Podivin', 'display_name': 'jpodivin', 'email': 'jpodivin@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpodivin'}]

[{'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-09-09 17:40:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-09-10 08:37:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-09-10 09:06:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-09-10 09:48:34.000000000', 'content': 'Set Ready For Review'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-09-10 09:48:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

test job: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/808184/'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2021-09-10 12:20:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-09-10 13:19:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Are we sure this won't cause the problems we're seeing with molecule where we're proposing pip-compile to address pip's resolution being stupid?"}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2021-09-12 22:05:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-09-13 05:47:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> Are we sure this won't cause the problems we're seeing with molecule where we're proposing pip-compile to address pip's resolution being stupid?

care to add some more context? We can then create a test job upon that one, just to be sure.. ?"}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-09-13 07:36:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/759057/ has some molecule tests, it should show any molecule related issue.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-09-13 14:39:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1942704  The thought was due to the lack of constraints, we're running into pip dependency resolution issues.  I asked why we don't use upper constraints rather than pip-compile. Of course there are issues with UC+molecule, but I don't think we should be dropping upper constraints"}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-09-13 15:27:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1
> 
> https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1942704  The thought was due to the lack of constraints, we're running into pip dependency resolution issues.  I asked why we don't use upper constraints rather than pip-compile. Of course there are issues with UC+molecule, but I don't think we should be dropping upper constraints

The thing is, this goes beyond molecule. It's actually that we have been treating UC as something else than they are. When we use UC as the value for the `-c` arg, we are forcing pip to install exactly the version specified, and nothing else. 

The name is slightly misleading in that regard. Pip knows only one, absolute, kind of constraints. Upper, lower, global etc. those are openstack/requirements terms. 

Taking into account the fact that UC source is mutable, and often changed using automation, we can easily end up with situation where there is no package available that satisfies both UC and requirements files.

Alternative to UC, that would provide some of the same benefit but without the danger of one change breaking pipelines, would be global-requirements, or per-project constraints file."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-09-13 16:21:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> > Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1
> > 
> > https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1942704  The thought was due to the lack of constraints, we're running into pip dependency resolution issues.  I asked why we don't use upper constraints rather than pip-compile. Of course there are issues with UC+molecule, but I don't think we should be dropping upper constraints
> 
> The thing is, this goes beyond molecule. It's actually that we have been treating UC as something else than they are. When we use UC as the value for the `-c` arg, we are forcing pip to install exactly the version specified, and nothing else. 
> 

I don't think that's a valid statement per https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/user_guide/#watch-out-for

Constraints donâ€™t override the existing requirements; they simply constrain what versions are visible as input to the resolver (see #9020)

> The name is slightly misleading in that regard. Pip knows only one, absolute, kind of constraints. Upper, lower, global etc. those are openstack/requirements terms. 
> 
> Taking into account the fact that UC source is mutable, and often changed using automation, we can easily end up with situation where there is no package available that satisfies both UC and requirements files.
> 
> Alternative to UC, that would provide some of the same benefit but without the danger of one change breaking pipelines, would be global-requirements, or per-project constraints file.


Openstack has been using UC for years now, across the board so I'm not certain removing it is the correct move.  This needs further thought & discussion.  The main issue is that I don't want to manage requirements per project which is what the pip-compile patches are doing. I really thing that's not the correct direction and I'd prefer we address issues we're hitting with upper constraints than redoing how we do dependencies for these python jobs."}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-09-14 06:34:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> > Patch Set 3:
> > 
> > > Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1
> > > 
> > > https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1942704  The thought was due to the lack of constraints, we're running into pip dependency resolution issues.  I asked why we don't use upper constraints rather than pip-compile. Of course there are issues with UC+molecule, but I don't think we should be dropping upper constraints
> > 
> > The thing is, this goes beyond molecule. It's actually that we have been treating UC as something else than they are. When we use UC as the value for the `-c` arg, we are forcing pip to install exactly the version specified, and nothing else. 
> > 
> 
> I don't think that's a valid statement per https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/user_guide/#watch-out-for
> 
> Constraints donâ€™t override the existing requirements; they simply constrain what versions are visible as input to the resolver (see #9020)

That's true in general. But in the upper-constraints.txt, as specified by openstack/requirements, the versions are set as arbitrary equalities[1]. This means that only one version, the one set in the UC file, is going to be available to the package manager.[2] 

And what is normally a constraint, turns into an override.

It's possible to test this in venv with an arbitrary package.
For example, suppose the version is set to <x in requirements.txt and to ===x in the constraints.txt.
Installation with `pip install -r requirements -c constraints.txt` will fail with:

   ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement package<1
   ERROR: No matching distribution found for package<1

 
> 
> > The name is slightly misleading in that regard. Pip knows only one, absolute, kind of constraints. Upper, lower, global etc. those are openstack/requirements terms. 
> > 
> > Taking into account the fact that UC source is mutable, and often changed using automation, we can easily end up with situation where there is no package available that satisfies both UC and requirements files.
> > 
> > Alternative to UC, that would provide some of the same benefit but without the danger of one change breaking pipelines, would be global-requirements, or per-project constraints file.
> 
> 
> Openstack has been using UC for years now, across the board so I'm not certain removing it is the correct move.  This needs further thought & discussion.  The main issue is that I don't want to manage requirements per project which is what the pip-compile patches are doing. I really thing that's not the correct direction and I'd prefer we address issues we're hitting with upper constraints than redoing how we do dependencies for these python jobs.

I agree with that. Which is why I would suggest the global-requierements.txt file from the openstack/requirements as an alternative. That would at least block all of the truly incompatible version from being pulled.

[1]https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0440/#arbitrary-equality
[2]https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/dependency-management.html#format"}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-09-17 06:25:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

An earlier issue https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1931986 in tripleoclient where we had issues for not using uc.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-09-17 06:48:55.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

there's probably a better way, but dropping UC isn't what we want."}]

commit_message:
We probably don't need upper constraints for doc

It doesn't really make sense to constraint the libs used to build the
doc - let's drop it.

Closes-Bug: #1943170

Change-Id: I4b1ddf2abb8602a66fe2ccf99383ecb37d490235

commit_message:
InStorage: revert to snapshot feature support.

This patch implements the 'rever_to_snapshot' cinder volume
driver API.

Change-Id: I4add2810baf240423eefb69e9acebaceefcd865d

commit_message:
Mitigate unauthenticated SSH session issue

Spectrum virtualize Familye storage allows 3 unauthenticated
concurrent SSH session. If deploy cinder volume in multi active/active
topology, it may reach this limitation very easily. This patch add
lock mechanism to startup driver serially.

Change-Id: Iae411a64e674203b1cf2311ff0819806911fabb8
Partial-Bug: #1871546

[{'created': '2021-07-20 07:43:50.000000000', 'message': '[WIP]Sample script for deploying k8s with kubespray

This patch provides a sample script that allows users to install
or delete kubernetes on VMs in the VNF when executing
instantiate/terminate/scale/heal through the kubespray ansible
server.

It also provides script to install and configure Load Balancer
for kubernetes cluster in the VNF.

Change-Id: I45661b5d8006e87db5f46a595756231849723ce6

or delete kubernetes on VMs in the VNF when executing

Implements: blueprint k8s-mgmtdriver-kubespray
Change-Id: I45661b5d8006e87db5f46a595756231849723ce6
'}, {'created': '2021-07-30 08:19:04.000000000', 'message': "[WIP]Sample script for deploying k8s with kubespray

This patch provides a sample script that allows users to install
or delete kubernetes on VMs in the VNF when executing
instantiate/terminate/scale/heal through the kubespray ansible
server.
It also provides script to install and configure Load Balancer
for kubernetes cluster in the VNF.

When instantiating CNF with service resource whose type is
`NodePort` on vim deployed by kubespary, it's port must be added
into Load Balancer's configuration and restart it. So this patch
also provides a sample MgmtDriver and shell script to fix this
problem.

At the same time, we found that if instantiate operation fails,
after the `instantiate_end` operation, the `terminate_end` operation
will not be executed in the rollback, which may cause the
modification in `instantiate_end` remains in the environment, so
this patch adds a `terminate_end` operation in `post_rollback_vnf`.

Implements: blueprint k8s-mgmtdriver-kubespray
Change-Id: I45661b5d8006e87db5f46a595756231849723ce6
"}, {'created': '2021-08-04 06:53:57.000000000', 'message': "Sample script for deploying k8s with kubespray

commit_message:
Sample script for deploying k8s with kubespray

This patch provides a sample script that allows users to install
or delete kubernetes on VMs in the VNF when executing
instantiate/terminate/scale/heal through the kubespray ansible
server.
It also provides script to install and configure Load Balancer
for kubernetes cluster in the VNF.

When instantiating CNF with service resource whose type is
`NodePort` on Kubernetes VIM deployed by kubespray, its port must
be added into Load Balancer's configuration and restart it. So
this patch also provides a sample MgmtDriver and shell script
to fix this problem.

At the same time, we found that if instantiate operation fails,
after the `instantiate_end` operation, the `terminate_end` operation
will not be executed in the rollback, which may cause the
modification in `instantiate_end` remains in the environment, so
this patch adds a `terminate_end` operation in `post_rollback_vnf`.

Implements: blueprint k8s-mgmtdriver-kubespray
Change-Id: I45661b5d8006e87db5f46a595756231849723ce6

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Idf8ba67b0bd6155ed60474723b63e290da22a237

commit_message:
Fix typos in zone policy deprecations

Two of the zone policies were referencing the wrong policy variables in
the same file. This causes oslo.policy to think the rules were changing
when they are not. This commit updates the policy deprecations to use
the proper deprecated rules for the appropriate policies.

Change-Id: I68b71e680cd72692b0bcb470be1bc4902d5e7bc8

commit_message:
Fix count_record policy to use the right deprecation variable

The cound record policy was referencing the wrong variable name for the
deprecated rule. This causes oslo.policy to generate a deprecation
warning that didn't make sense since it thought the policy name was
changing.

This commit updates the rule to use the proper deprecation.

Change-Id: Ic686d35c25436a1bca83c4bb9c62ebf28a445f28

subject: Fix update blacklist policy deprecation
messages: [{'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2021-09-07 17:53:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2021-09-07 17:54:12.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to secure-rbac'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2021-09-07 18:47:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nYep, we didn't catch this one in the other patch chain."}, {'account_id': 19298, 'date': '2021-09-07 19:06:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2021-09-17 00:20:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-07 17:53:47.000000000', 'message': "Fix update blacklist policy deprecation

The update blacklist policy deprecation was using the wrong variable and
referenced the policy for get blacklist. This was a typo and causes
oslo.policy to alias the old name with the new name since it things the
policy name is changing, which isn't the case.

This commit updates the policy to use the correct deprecated policy
rule.

Change-Id: I702a4cbef6d580249d17875af34b35822c0c9d32
"}]
commit_message:
Fix update blacklist policy deprecation

The update blacklist policy deprecation was using the wrong variable and
referenced the policy for get blacklist. This was a typo and causes
oslo.policy to alias the old name with the new name since it things the
policy name is changing, which isn't the case.

This commit updates the policy to use the correct deprecated policy
rule.

Change-Id: I702a4cbef6d580249d17875af34b35822c0c9d32

messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2021-09-15 15:20:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2021-09-15 15:55:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9257, 'date': '2021-09-15 18:04:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2021-09-16 05:59:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2021-09-16 06:23:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-09-16 12:32:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2021-09-16 18:29:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-15 15:20:39.000000000', 'message': "WIP Remove /etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.conf

puppet-rabbitmq does not support the ini file format yet.
Let's remove the stock config here as it is confusing,
our generated rabbitmq.config in erlang takes precedence anyways

Change-Id: I2b17c3bc930f5964e19c261db65f79593173fb95
"}, {'created': '2021-09-15 15:55:16.000000000', 'message': "Remove /etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.conf

Currently the rabbitmq container image ships the default rabbitmq
ini-based conf file:
$ podman run -it --net=host --rm -uroot undercloud-0.ctlplane.bgp.ftw:8787/tripleomaster/openstack-rabbitmq:current-tripleo sh -c 'ls -l /etc/rabbitmq/'
  -rw-r--r--. 1 rabbitmq rabbitmq 32393 Mar 9 2020 rabbitmq.conf

$ podman run -it --net=host --rm -uroot undercloud-0.ctlplane.bgp.ftw:8787/tripleomaster/openstack-rabbitmq:current-tripleo sh -c 'head -n5 /etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.conf'
  # ======================================
  # RabbitMQ broker section
  # ======================================

  ## Related doc guide: https://rabbitmq.com/configure.html. See

In puppet we instead create /etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.config and it still
uses the erlang syntax.  See https://github.com/voxpupuli/puppet-rabbitmq/issues/829 for info.
Even though /etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.config and its erlang syntax take
precedence over /etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.conf, we should prolly remove the
non used config format from the container

Closes-Bug: #1943731

Change-Id: I2b17c3bc930f5964e19c261db65f79593173fb95
"}]
commit_message:
Remove /etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.conf

Currently the rabbitmq container image ships the default rabbitmq
ini-based conf file:
$ podman run -it --net=host --rm -uroot undercloud-0.ctlplane.bgp.ftw:8787/tripleomaster/openstack-rabbitmq:current-tripleo sh -c 'ls -l /etc/rabbitmq/'
  -rw-r--r--. 1 rabbitmq rabbitmq 32393 Mar 9 2020 rabbitmq.conf

$ podman run -it --net=host --rm -uroot undercloud-0.ctlplane.bgp.ftw:8787/tripleomaster/openstack-rabbitmq:current-tripleo sh -c 'head -n5 /etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.conf'
  # ======================================
  # RabbitMQ broker section
  # ======================================

  ## Related doc guide: https://rabbitmq.com/configure.html. See

In puppet we instead create /etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.config and it still
uses the erlang syntax.  See https://github.com/voxpupuli/puppet-rabbitmq/issues/829 for info.
Even though /etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.config and its erlang syntax take
precedence over /etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.conf, we should prolly remove the
non used config format from the container

Closes-Bug: #1943731

commit_message:
LVM: Retry lvextend commands on code 139

Retry lvextend commands upon segfault, similar to other
LVM calls.  This affects the volume extend path.

Change-Id: I0c0cb5308246a3dce736eade67b40be063aa78bb
Related-Bug: #1901783
Related-Bug: #1932188
Closes-Bug: #1940436
(cherry picked from commit c4b8956763c2759bd2b9fe511efac5b3edfb226d)
(cherry picked from commit 2425f3ef590524c357622748df79d87edebd17f3)

support GET /v1/drivers/?fields=...

It requires setting the API version for Ironic to 1.30 at least.

commit_message:
Add support for fields in drivers API

This commit add support for the fields query parameter to the GET /v1/drivers?fields=... and GET /v1/drivers/<driver_name>?fields=....

Story: 1674775
Task: 10581
Change-Id: I2ca4eb490e320e736a93851eed526ec862be901e

commit_message:
Implement project personas for volume actions

The unit tests added for the volume actions policies required a
couple of updates to other unit tests:
- A request context was added to test_volume_revert_update_status_failed
- Several VolumeTransferTestCase tests were updated to use a context
  when mocking volume notifications. This is necessary to prevent
  other tests running in parallel that generate their own notifications
  from affecting the VolumeTransferTestCase tests.

Change-Id: Iba63f8d88f2fc8283e9f6b5c4b03f2045865f1af

commit_message:
LVM: Retry lvdisplay and lvcreate calls on segfault

This is a follow-up to I0a2420f3e4a411f5fa52ebe2d22859b138ef387f.

LVM commands segfault occasionally, exiting with code 139.
Change I6824ba4f introduced a workaround to retry the command
when code 139 is returned, which generally works.

Closes-Bug: #1932188
Change-Id: I7c0f4d4ea7de635afede3c8514a5da9e85ad9b48
(cherry picked from commit a8552ed2d69ae4c0f3ec97fa92395cd245a8d848)
(cherry picked from commit 77d4aa6a898d25e7fb3ffccd1386b84d3f1ba1d3)

commit_message:
Don't run periodic_share_replica_update() on active replicas

Similarly to periodic_share_replica_snapshot_update() skip active
replicas and do what the comment above says.

Change-Id: I719c670416c06f8eb9228a3537034285ae3733b4
Partial-Bug: #1924230

confusing because they share the same title

BUT the default is already being set there https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/src/commit/abccbfa1ce060412b68961beeb6177af743f0692/roles/extras-common/defaults/main.yml#L170

so maybe no dependency needed in either case?

commit_message:
Do not hard-code overcloud-full image name

The var overcloud_image defaults to overcloud-full, and will until the
switchover to the whole-disk overcloud.

Change-Id: I8037e8140e36ed0cd56e1654c4a8269dfbd4b5d1
Blueprint: whole-disk-default

subject: backup: ceph: add support for snapshot mirroring based replication

commit_message:
backup: ceph: add support for snapshot mirroring based replication

Add a new configration option `backup_ceph_image_snapshot_mirroring` to
enable mirroring with the snapshot mode on the created RBD images.

As cinder-backup is the only writer to the backup images, we create the
mirror snapshot directly in cinder-backup. The operator will not have to
enable mirror snapshot scheduling with the MGR. This have some
performance benefits saving the Ceph cluster from handling several
unecessary snapshots and will improve the RPO as the replication will be
started immediatly once the backup has been completed.

Signed-off-by: Arthur Outhenin-Chalandre <arthur.outhenin-chalandre@cern.ch>
Partial-Implements: blueprint rbd-snapshot-mirroring
Change-Id: I93f2a1a79cdb82e42ae5ced832a8f3905adb8574

commit_message:
Update master for stable/xena

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/xena.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/xena.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I307fdfc8957028671706265f0575789afa5e60af

commit_message:
Revert "[L3][HA] Retry when setting HA router GW status."

In short this patch can cause the privsep reader thread to
die resulting in the l3 agent getting stuck and e.g. not
processing any router updates. See related LP bug for full
explanation.

Closes-Bug: #1927868

This reverts commit 662f483120972a373e19bde52f16392e2ccb9c82.

Change-Id: Ide7e9771d08eb623dd75941e425813d9b857b4c6
(cherry picked from commit 344fc0c8d2ce7d942606c834a54cb81f0b47aa37)

commit_message:
Run TripleO jobs on CentOS8 instead of CentOS7

As we are cleaning up the c7 jobs and obselete featuresets [1].
This change replaces usage of CentOS7 in TripleO jobs by CentOS8.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22cleanup_featuresets%22+(status:open%20OR%20status:merged)

Change-Id: I0c5b95d84dfed68fac59b0dc305dec39ecf5fa8a

commit_message:
Implement Xena project personas for group_actions

This change implements default roles for the group APIs.

Also removes the following from tests/unit/policy.yaml:
-"group:delete": ""
-"group:reset_status": ""
-"group:enable_replication": ""
-"group:disable_replication": ""
-"group:failover_replication": ""
-"group:list_replication_targets": ""

Co-Authored-by: Lance Bragstad <lbragstad@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-by: Sofia Enriquez <lsofia.enriquez@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I9d93f2ef1565d3554bf12025a5568989b4e99c4d

commit_message:
Add extra check to server migration complete test

The change [1] modified the share server migration complete
operation behavior in Manila.

In the previous behavior there was a chance that manila would
keep the inactive source share server after a successful
migration.

Such behavior is not possible anymore after this change was
merged, since Manila started to expect that the source share
servers were deleted within the successful completion of a share
server migration.

This change introduces a new waiter to make sure that the source
share server is actually being deleted from manila after the
migration complete phase.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila/+/803623

Change-Id: Ibb092111032241a71763da0c7fa40470a3cd95ae

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iecd85c399034349172310977f87130ad954db649

problems in the latest document

commit_message:
Run TripleO jobs on CentOS8 instead of CentOS7

As we are cleaning up the c7 jobs and obselete featuresets [1].
This change replaces usage of CentOS7 in TripleO jobs by CentOS8.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22cleanup_featuresets%22+(status:open%20OR%20status:merged)

Change-Id: I0c5b95d84dfed68fac59b0dc305dec39ecf5fa8a
